org.diirt.graphene

Class GraphBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.diirt.graphene.GraphBuffer

  • public class GraphBuffer
extends Object
    Provides low level drawing operations, at the right granularity to perform them efficiently, but without performing any high level decisions (e.g. formatting, layout)

    This class takes care of putting the pixels where it is told. It specifically does not concerns itself with the calculation of what/where to draw. It provides the drawing of aggregated data structures, so that the plotting can be efficient and clean.

    It also serves as a wrapper around Java2D (Graphics2D) so that the drawing can be re-implemented efficiently on other engines in the future, such as JavaFX.

    Author:
    carcassi, sjdallst, asbarber, jkfeng

        height - height of the graph

      • GraphBuffer

        public GraphBuffer(Graph2DRenderer<?> renderer)
        Creates a GraphBuffer suitable for the given renderer. Makes sure all the parameters from the renderer are consistent with the buffer itself.
        Parameters:
        renderer - the graph renderer

        Parameters:

        y - y-coordinate of a pixel
        color - color-value of the pixel

      • drawDataImage

        public void drawDataImage(int xStartPoint,
                          int yStartPoint,
                          int[] xPointToDataMap,
                          int[] yPointToDataMap,
                          Cell2DDataset data,
                          NumberColorMapInstance colorMap)
        Plots a two dimensional array of values encoded by color.
        Parameters:
        xStartPoint - the horizontal coordinate for the first pixel of the image
        yStartPoint - the vertical coordinate for the first pixel of the image
        xPointToDataMap - a map from pixel horizontal offset to data index
        yPointToDataMap - a map from pixel vertical offset to data index
        data - the dataset to be plotted
        colorMap - the color map

      • setXScaleAsCell

        public void setXScaleAsCell(Range range,
                            int xMinPixel,
                            int xMaxPixel,
                            ValueScale xValueScale)
        Sets the scaling data for the x axis assuming values are going to represent cells. The minimum value is going to be positioned at the left of the xMinPixel while the maximum value is going to be position at the right of the xMaxPixel.
        Parameters:
        range - the range to be displayed
        xMinPixel - the pixel corresponding to the minimum
        xMaxPixel - the pixel corresponding to the maximum
        xValueScale - the scale used to transform values to pixel

      • setXScaleAsPoint

        public void setXScaleAsPoint(Range range,
                             int xMinPixel,
                             int xMaxPixel,
                             ValueScale xValueScale)
        Sets the scaling data for the x axis assuming values are going to represent points. The minimum value is going to be positioned in the center of the xMinPixel while the maximum value is going to be position in the middle of the xMaxPixel.
        Parameters:
        range - the range to be displayed
        xMinPixel - the pixel corresponding to the minimum
        xMaxPixel - the pixel corresponding to the maximum
        xValueScale - the scale used to transform values to pixel

      • xValueToPixel

        Returns:
        the pixel where the value should be mapped
